title: Top Places to visit in Sanivarapupeta, Andhra Pradesh
content:
Sanivarapupeta is a census town in West Godavari district of the Indian state of Andhra Pradesh. It is located in the Eluru Mandal of the Eluru revenue division. The town is a constituent of Eluru urban agglomeration.

title: Top Places to visit in Samalkot, Andhra Pradesh
content:
Samalkota is a town in East Godavari district of the Indian state of Andhra Pradesh. The town also forms a part of the Godavari Urban Development Authority. Previously spelled as Samulcottah.

title: Top Places to visit in Salur, Andhra Pradesh
content:
Salur or Saluru is a municipal town and Mandal headquarters in Vizianagaram district, of the Indian state of Andhra Pradesh.

title: Top Places to visit in Repalle, Andhra Pradesh
content: Repalle is a town in the Guntur district of the Indian state of Andhra Pradesh. The town is one of the 12 municipalities in Guntur district and the headquarters of Repalle Mandal under the administration of the Tenali revenue division. title: Top Places to visit in Renigunta, Andhra Pradesh
content:
Renigunta is a census town in Chittoor District of the Indian state of Andhra Pradesh. It is a suburb of Tirupati and the Mandal headquarters of Renigunta Mandal.

title: Top Places to visit in Rayadurg, Andhra Pradesh
content:
Rayadurga is a town in the Anantapur district of the Indian state of Andhra Pradesh. It is the headquarters of Rayadurgam Mandal in the Kalyandurg revenue division. The town is renowned for its Handloom industry.

title: Top Places to visit in Rayachoti, Andhra Pradesh
content: Rayachoty or "Rachaveedu" or "Rayachoti" or "Rajaveedu" is a town in Kadapa district of the Indian state of Andhra Pradesh. title: Top Places to visit in Ramachandrapuram, Andhra Pradesh
content:
Ramachandrapuram is a town in East Godavari district of the Indian state of Andhra Pradesh. The town is a Municipality that serves as the headquarters of Ramachandrapuram Mandal and Ramachandrapuram revenue division.

Top Places to visit in Puttur, Andhra Pradesh
content:
Puttur is a city in Dakshina Kannada district, in the Karnataka state of India. It is the headquarters of Puttur taluk. It is the second-largest and the fastest-growing city in Dakshina Kannada district of Karnataka after Mangalore. The Puttur Shree Mahalingeshwara Temple is located here.
